results.title: Steering, wheels, front and rear axles
results.creator_credit: United States. Army. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to check for play in the steering wheel and the front end assembly; correct wheel run-out; make a test; test springs, axles and overall back-lash.

results.title: Engine assembly
results.creator_credit: Gene K Walker and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Shows how to check the cylinder head and block; intake and exhaust manifolds; under-chassis parts; valve mechanism and tappets; vents, screws and air filters; oil filter and oil lines; and cylinder depression.

results.title: The Hydraulic brake system
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Century Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Automobile Maintenance”.
Illustrates how to check brake pedal travel; examine the brake lining; adjust thebrake shoes; inspect shoes; inspect and adjust the hydraulic fluid system - taking care of minor problems prevents major problems.

results.title: Margaret Atwood
results.creator_credit: Tracey Fisher, Tier One Communications and TV Ontario
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Authors at the harbourfront”.
Margaret Atwood launches her latest work ‘Cat’s eye’ which explores the world of childhood, secrecies, loyalties and betrayals.

results.title: Patsy Adam-Smith: author and social historian
results.creator_credit: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian women’s archival Series”.
An archival interview in which Patsy tells of her childhood, the inspirations for her books, her philosophy on oral history, her working methods, the adventure of her life at sea and her thoughts on love, children and marriage. Most of her books focus on the lives of ‘ordinary’ Australian working people, uncovering the unique history, folklore and lifestyle - the ‘real’ history of Australia, often lost in the overview of traditional history. Tagged as an ‘unconventional woman’, Patsy ignored the social rules of her day, and blithely worked in, sought out and wrote about the worlds in which women traditionally had no place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Janet McLeod, Catherine South and Women’s Program of the AFC
